intro: Dodonaea intricata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hop萧, is a shrub native to Australia. It features small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a dry, woody capsule containing several seeds. Dodonaea intricata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
